information_for_contributors: This file has been converted from https://github.com/PowerShell/EditorSyntax/blob/master/PowerShellSyntax.tmLanguage
If you want to provide a fix or improvement, please create a pull request against the original repository.
Once accepted there, we are happy to receive an update request.
name: PowerShell

patterns.comment: optional user specified type, PowerShell Core >= 6.2.0
after testing for pre unary operators, after anything has matched, stay locked in expression mode.
do,for,foreach,while: allow a `:label` that must start the statement; A `:label` before a loop looks just like a function, and its possible to put the loop keyword on a later line!
break,continue: permit a label following, then revert back to statement mode
!!this needs rewritten as it cannot test for a preunary operator until after the first token has been located!!  This logic needs updated in multiple locations
after testing for pre unary operators, after anything has matched, stay locked in expression mode.
-parallel parameter can only be used in a workflow, consider using meta scopes, and an injection to properly catch this
patterns.name: entity.name.parameter.powershell

patterns.comment: from,var,define are reserved
patterns.name: invalid.reserved.keyword.control.$0.powershell

patterns.comment: default: only in switch; else,elsif: only after if,elseif; until: only after do; catch,finally: only after try; parallel,sequence,inlinescript only in a workflow
patterns.name: keyword.control.$0.powershell

patterns.comment: `||` and `&&` conditional terminators are reserved.
patterns.name: invalid.reserved.powershell

patterns.comment: `;` resume's in statement mode.
patterns.name: punctuation.terminator.statement.powershell

patterns.comment: (dot) source operator, requires trailing space, or invoke operator
Next token needs to be an operand for the operator, not the actual command, but an expression or unquoted expandable string that describes the command's name.
could be a numeric constant or a limited list of unary operators, that we should switch to expression mode
if numeric constant advanced, switch to expression mode
if numeric constant didn't advanced, try finishing command mode with a command name
`|` resume's in command mode
`,` just continues current mode
patterns.name: punctuation.separator.powershell

patterns.comment: `,` just continues current mode
patterns.name: punctuation.separator.powershell

patterns.comment: Verb-Noun pattern:
Builtin cmdlets with reserved verbs, trailing negative lookahead needs work
after testing for pre unary operators, after anything has matched, stay locked in expression mode.

type.comment: This is used by both type and attribute references.

type_keywords.comment: primitive types and base classes often used

patterns.comment: consume spaces and comments and line ends until the next token appears

variable_inner.comment: seperate the parts of the variable name and scope them

patterns.comment: These are special constants.
These are the other built-in constants.
Style preference variables as language variables so that they stand out.
Unknown drive
patterns.name: storage.type.drive.powershell

patterns.comment: this captures up to the first colon, and then matches up the capture
this captures up to the first colon, and then matches up the capture
splatting cannot have members and certain characters following, including no line comment
`;` resume's in statement mode.
patterns.name: punctuation.terminator.statement.powershell

patterns.comment: `,` just continues current mode
patterns.name: punctuation.separator.powershell

patterns.comment: the range operator is only available after an operand (binary operator)
when nothing else matches in usual tokenizing, consume it to prevent other patterns from striking in the middle of what might be a command name.
